titleStmt.title: In the matter of the application of William Warden for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Sheriff Return

bibl.title: William Warden v. John H. McGraw. Sheriff Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

div1.p:
In the District Court at Seattle W. T.
In the matter of the application of William Warden application for writ of Habeas Corpus
Territory of Washington W. William Warden County of King

John H McGraw being first duly sworn before me another the clerk of the above named Court and deposes and says that he is now and during all times herein named was the Sheriff and Jailor of King County, that the petitioner William Warden alias Ross is from information and belief sufficient to affiant from telegrams made a part hereof and herby attached and other believe and know that the petitioner has been duly convicted of the crime of burglary and duly sentenced to the Penitentiary of the the offense being committed in California that the said sentence was for fourteen years that said

prisonment had that expired, that the petitioner unlawfully while so serving said imprisonment escaped and became a fugitive for of Justice, and is none such a fugitive from the State of California that the said petitioner is now in this County as such fugitive, that the Governor and executive of California has duly demanded the delivery of said petitioner and has now documents and papers duly certified by said state officals to recieve said Fugitive that said fugitive is now guilty of Burglary so committed in said state and is now held on warrant charging him with said offense, said warrant being returnable to Justice of the Peace C. M. Rivers, to be duly heard by said Rivers as by law prescribed. That the Territorial Prosecuting attorney had the said cause under consideration and investigation as required by law. That the affiant of the State of California to wit Sheriff will arrive on May 28 1889 to recieve the Custody of said fugitive as by law perscribed warranted.
